title: Your Ultimate Listing Appointment Checklist: Win More Listings
excerpt: Key Points A listing checklist ensures you never miss crucial steps or documents. Prep key documents like disclosures, CMA, and your listing agreement in advance.…
content:
Key Points

  • A listing checklist ensures you never miss crucial steps or documents.
  • Prep key documents like disclosures, CMA, and your listing agreement in advance.
  • Know the seller’s motivation and communication style before pitching.
  • First impressions matter – lead with confidence and a positive tone.
  • Use data-driven CMA insights, not opinions, to support pricing strategy.
  • Overcome objections with practiced, confident, value-based responses.
  • Showcase a real marketing plan with results, not empty promises.
  • Practice tough seller objections through role-playing to build confidence.
  • Always follow up after the listing appointment – don’t let the lead go cold.

Alright, real estate pros, let’s be real – walking into a listing appointment unprepared is like showing up to a first date in pajama pants. You’re not getting a second chance. If you’ve ever fumbled through tough seller objections, forgotten key documents, or felt like you were winging it, you know how painful it can be.

But here’s the good news – there’s a better way. With a rock-solid listing appointment checklist, you’ll walk in looking like a pro, handle objections like a boss, and leave with a signed listing agreement.  Here’s your handy-dandy index:

Why a Checklist is a Game Changer
How to Prepare for the Appointment
Running the Appointment Like a Pro
Practicing and Role-Playing
Follow Up After the Appointment
The Listing Checklist That Turns You Into a Top Agent
Frequently Asked Questions

Why a Checklist is a Game Changer

A listing appointment isn’t just a chat about selling a house – it’s your audition to be their agent. A checklist keeps you from missing critical details, ensures you look polished, and makes the seller feel like they’re in the hands of a professional. Think of it like packing for a big trip – you don’t want to show up at the airport without your passport, right? Your checklist is your passport to winning more listings.

How to Prepare for the Appointment

Winning the listing starts before you knock on the door. Prep like a pro, or risk looking like an amateur. Here’s how to make sure you’re locked, loaded, and ready to impress.

Gather Essential Documents

Nothing kills credibility faster than shuffling through your bag looking for a missing form. Plan to have your listing agreement, seller disclosures, and any required documents ready to go – neatly organized, digital or printed. Bonus points for a sleek presentation folder.

Analyze Market Comparables

Sellers want numbers, not guesswork. Do a solid Comparative Market Analysis (CMA) and plan to show them where their home stands in the market. For a step-by-step guide on creating an effective CMA, refer to the National Association of REALTORS®’ resource.

?Use recent sales, active listings, and expired listings to back up your pricing strategy. But plan to hold your final price until after you see the home and after the seller tells you what THEY think their home is worth. Then you’ll know what you’re dealing with as far as seller expectations go.

Understand the Seller’s Needs

Not all sellers are the same. Some want top dollar, some need a quick sale, and some just want an agent who will actually answer their calls. Plan to ask questions that will pull out what they want, and then tailor your approach to their priorities.

Identify Communication Preferences

If you’re a great agent, you’ll be communicating frequently and regularly with your clients.  So, plan to ask how they want that communication to happen. Some clients love phone calls, others only want texts or emails. Get clear on how they prefer to communicate and respect that – it makes working together a whole lot smoother.

Create a Standout Listing Presentation

Plan a listing presentation that will be clear, engaging, and to the point, and keep it short and visually appealing. Nobody wants a 45-minute PowerPoint. Bring printed materials or a slick digital version they can reference. And, hey, by the way, we at Smart Agent Alliance provide a great digital listing presentation, one that you can easily customize as your own, when you join Exp Realty and name us as your sponsor.

Running the Appointment Like a Pro

Alright, you’re in the door. Now what?

First Impressions Matter

Smile. Make eye contact. Be confident. If you fumble your introduction, you’ll spend the rest of the appointment trying to recover. So practice if you need to and, of course, be interested in their home and confident about selling it. And, remember, no one wants to hire an agent who points out all the home’s negatives. That just makes the seller think that you’re not the right agent to put the positive spin on it.

Present Market Insights Like a Boss

Sellers don’t care about your opinion – they care about facts. So, you already did your pricing homework.  Now bring charts, graphs, and data to back up your pricing recommendations. Make it visual and easy to understand. And if they hit you with the dreaded “I want to price it higher than that” objection? Show them the expired listings and explain why overpricing is the fastest way to not sell a house.

Handle Objections Before They Come Up

Expect objections and be ready with solid responses. If they push back on commission, break down the value you bring. If they’re hesitant to list right away, discuss market trends and timing strategies. The Mike Ferry Organization offers a comprehensive list of 40 real estate objections and how to handle them.

The key? Stay calm, confident, and solution-focused.

Outline Your Marketing Strategy

Here’s where you show them why you are the best agent for the job. Explain your marketing plan – professional photos, social media ads, virtual tours, open houses. Show them real examples of how you market homes. For inspiration, explore these real estate marketing plan examples from industry leaders.

If another agent is promising the world, remind them that flashy talk is easy; proven results are what matter.

Practicing and Role-Playing

Hey, if you don’t feel like you’re ready to conquer the appointment, even the best agents practice. If you haven’t role-played a listing appointment before, now’s the time.

Why Role-Playing Works

Ever heard of muscle memory? Practicing responses to objections makes them second nature. That way, when a seller asks a tough question, you won’t freeze up – instead, you’ll deliver a smooth, confident response.

Be Ready for Common Objections

The Seller says, “I think my home is worth more.” You say, “I totally understand, and I want to get you the best price possible. Let’s look at what buyers are actually paying in your area so we can price it right and get it sold fast.”  Or the seller says, “Another agent said they’d do it for a lower commission.”  You say: “That’s great! But do they offer the same level of marketing and negotiation expertise? The right agent makes you more money, not just saves you a little upfront.”

Nail the Tough Questions

If you can answer these questions without hesitation, you’re in good shape:

  • What makes you different from other agents?
  • How will you market my home?
  • What happens if my home doesn’t sell?
  • Why should I list with you today?  So, work on your answers to those!

Spend some serious time determining what your answers will be to those questions.  That way, you won’t be caught off guard and instead will come off as the polished, experienced, professional that you are.

Follow Up After the Appointment

Okay, the appointment is over. If you think you crushed the appointment, or even if you don’t think you did, don’t drop the ball.

Send a Follow-Up Thank You

A handwritten note or a personalized email goes a long way. Thank them for their time and remind them why you’re the best choice to sell their home.

Outline the Next Steps

Make it clear what happens next. If they’re ready to list, you will be walking them through the paperwork. If they need time to decide who they will list with, schedule a follow-up. Keep the momentum going.

Gather Feedback

You can also ask them how they felt about the meeting. What questions do they still have? Their feedback can help you improve for future appointments.

The Listing Checklist That Turns You Into a Top Agent

A successful listing appointment starts way before you ring the doorbell. With this ultimate listing checklist, you’re not just winging it – you’re walking in with confidence, clarity, and a strategy that proves you’re the right agent for the job. For more tips to gain clients, be sure to check out our Agent Success Hub.

And you don’t have to figure it out alone when you join eXp and name Smart Agent Alliance as your sponsor, we have a proven customizable listing presentation all ready for you to make it your own.  Plus, we do more:

Smart Agent Alliance runs meetings so you gain passive income and gives agents access to:

  • A done-for-you and hosted real estate attraction website
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($10,500 value) for social media marketing
  • Weekly coaching sessions with top producers
  • Customizable lead funnels, email campaigns, and marketing templates
  • And more…

All free for agents who join through the Smart Agent Alliance sponsor line. Learn more about how eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance can help you scale your career. Not sure if eXp is the right fit for you? Take this quick quiz to find out if eXp is a good match—especially if support and systems matter to you.

Not sure how passive income grows?  You can play with the numbers using our exp realty revenue share calculator to see how much you could earn. Not sure how to become a real estate agent? We’ve got loads of helpful info on that too.

Frequently Asked Questions

What is a listing checklist for real estate agents?

A listing checklist is a step-by-step guide agents use to prepare for listing appointments and ensure nothing important is missed during client meetings.

Why is a listing presentation important?

A listing presentation shows potential clients how you’ll market and sell their home, helping you win their trust – and their listing.

What should a real estate agent bring to a listing appointment?

Bring a listing agreement, CMA, marketing materials, seller disclosures, and a clear plan for how you’ll sell their home.

How do real estate agents handle commission objections?

Top agents focus on value – explaining how their services help sellers net more, not just save upfront.

How do new real estate agents get listing clients?

New agents can win listings by preparing thoroughly, practicing responses, and using tools like listing checklists and roleplay to build confidence.

title: How eXp Events and Networking Are Structured
excerpt: Explore eXp events like EXPCON and Regional Rallies. Discover why real estate agents choose this virtual brokerage to connect and growth.
content:
Key Takeaways: eXp Realty events combine large-scale conferences, regional rallies, and grassroots meetups to create real collaboration inside a virtual brokerage. These events reinforce agent community, support shared learning, and provide opportunities for in-person relationship building.

TL;DR About eXp Realty Events

  • eXp Realty hosts large national, regional, and local agent events
  • EXPCON is the flagship annual conference for training and networking
  • Regional rallies provide localized education and collaboration
  • Many sponsor teams host additional in-person and virtual events
  • Grassroots agent meetups are common and encouraged
  • Events support collaboration without requiring physical offices

Just because eXp Realty is a virtual brokerage does not mean agents are operating in isolation. In practice, events are one of the strongest connectors inside the eXp ecosystem. From massive conferences like EXPCON to regional rallies and locally organized agent meetups, eXp agents have multiple ways to connect in person and build real professional relationships.

This article explains how eXp Realty events fit into the broader eXp Realty Community ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

What EXPCON Actually Is

Who Should Go?
Why It Matters
The eXp Realty Events App: Your Personal Guide to Not Getting Lost
eXp Regional Rallies: Local Vibes, Big Wins

What’s the Point of These Regional Events?
Why Regional Events Matter (Even If You Go to eXpcon)
Real Estate Networking, Minus the Awkward Nametags
Sponsor Team Meetups: Like a Family Reunion, But With Less Potato Salad

What Happens at Sponsor Events?
Not Every Sponsor Does This—But the Good Ones Do
Local Agent Meetups: Because Zoom Friends Are Even Better in Real Life

Why Do Agents Bother?
No Stage, No Sponsors, No Pressure
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Events

Are eXp Realty events required for agents?
How do eXp events compare to traditional brokerage conferences?
Related eXp Realty Community Guides

What EXPCON Actually Is

EXPCON is a multi-day annual conference designed for training, networking, and brokerage-wide updates. It’s open to anyone in real estate who wants to learn, connect, and grow. You’ll get insider updates on eXp Realty’s growth, tech tools, and business model as showcased in eXp World Holdings’ Events & Presentations. The EXPCON agenda includes everything from breakout sessions to keynotes from top producers to after-hours meetups that turn into mastermind sessions over margaritas.

Vendors and tech companies show up too, offering real-world tools, not just free pens and awkward sales pitches.

Who Should Go?

If you’re an eXp agent, this is your mothership calling. But EXPCON also welcomes brokers, industry experts, vendors, and real estate professionals curious about the best real estate brokerages, especially if you’re eyeing a move to a virtual real estate brokerage that actually works.

Newer agents? You’ll leave with tactical knowledge and a stack of contacts. Seasoned agents? You’ll sharpen your edge and pick up some gems along the way. Vendors? You’ll meet agents who actually use your tools (and aren’t afraid to tell you what they really think).

Why It Matters

This section explains why agents choose to attend eXp events, based on commonly reported experiences rather than guaranteed results. Think of EXPCON as your yearly shot of espresso for the soul and the spreadsheet. You’re not just sitting in chairs. You’re getting hands-on training, real-world examples, and the kind of networking that turns into referrals, partnerships, and revenue.

  • Learn what’s working right now in marketing, tech, social media, and lead gen.
  • Get behind-the-scenes access to eXp leadership’s vision and upcoming tools.
  • Meet the faces behind the profile pics you’ve been chatting with in Workplace all year.
  • Walk away with strategies, systems, and goals that don’t fizzle out by Monday.

The eXp Realty Events App: Your Personal Guide to Not Getting Lost

If you’ve ever fumbled through a 100-session conference with nothing but a paper map and vibes, you’ll love the eXp Realty Events App. It’s your sidekick for:

  • Customizing your EXPCON agenda and getting reminders before sessions start
  • Messaging other attendees for quick connections or coffee meetups
  • Scanning bios, workshop decks, and speaker updates on the fly

Want to connect with a top producer or set up a post-event Zoom with a new referral partner? This app makes it easy, efficient, and kinda fun.

eXp Regional Rallies: Local Vibes, Big Wins

Can’t swing the trip to EXPCON? Or maybe you just want more connection in between the big shows? That’s where eXp regional rallies come in.

These localized events offer a more intimate way for agents to plug into eXp’s culture without hopping on a cross-country flight. Whether it’s in Portland, Phoenix, or Peoria, regional events bring the energy of EXPCON to your backyard minus the long buffet lines and badge scanners.

They’re a key part of how eXp Realty fosters connection, learning, and collaboration on a hyper-local level. And yes, they’re still packed with value, insight, and people who get what it’s like to chase down appraisers and explain escrow in the same breath.

What’s the Point of These Regional Events?

Simple: to build real community and offer boots-on-the-ground support where agents live and work.

eXp regional rallies give agents a space to trade market-specific tactics with people who understand their local pain points. Think less “generic real estate hype,” and more “here’s how I’m closing listings in this exact zip code.”

You’ll get:

  • Networking with agents you might actually see again (hello, referral network!)
  • Training that’s tailored to your region’s quirks, competition, and client base
  • Workshops led by agents who have actually been there, done that—and have the market share to prove it

Whether it’s pricing strategy for high desert homes or creative ways to market fixer-uppers during a rainy season, these regional convos are pure gold for real estate pros navigating their niche markets.

Why Regional Events Matter (Even If You Go to eXpcon)

eXp regional events are more than just filler. They’re the connective tissue between the big ideas at EXPCON and your day-to-day grind. It’s like EXPCON hands you the strategy, and eXp regional rallies help you turn it into results.

They also build pre-conference momentum. Some rallies offer sneak peeks at upcoming EXPCON themes, giving you a head start. Others let you dive deeper into past topics you wanted more time with, just in a smaller, more hands-on setting.

Real Estate Networking, Minus the Awkward Nametags

While EXPCON is the megaphone, eXp regional events are the campfire. You’ll still meet powerhouse agents and industry leaders, but you’ll also get face time with nearby colleagues who understand your market and speak your language.

And that’s not just warm fuzzies. It’s referral-building, co-marketing potential, and real-deal support from people who want to see you win.

Sponsor Team Meetups: Like a Family Reunion, But With Less Potato Salad

Here’s the thing about eXp Realty; it’s massive. Like, “real estate agents on five continents” is massive. But just like a big university splits into smaller clubs, sororities, or fantasy football leagues, eXp agents often find their home base in a sponsor team.

And that’s where sponsor events come in.

Some of the more organized sponsor groups host their own in-person meetups to bring their agents together. These aren’t official eXp Realty events, but they’re one of the best-kept secrets of life at eXp. You get the global support of a top online real estate brokerage and the cozy camaraderie of a tight-knit team.

What Happens at Sponsor Events?

Honestly? It depends on the group. Some do structured training sessions that go deeper than what you’ll find in eXp World. Others keep it casual: think hiking, dinners, coworking days, or just grabbing a drink with people who actually get your pain when a client ghost-texts you mid-contingency.

Some sponsor teams meet on Zoom every week, so when we show up in person, it’s less “awkward handshake” and more “hug your accountability partner and swap listing war stories.”

These events are designed to:

  • Build friendships that don’t feel like networking
  • Strengthen your referral connections inside the team
  • Learn, laugh, and maybe even vent a little with people who get it

Not Every Sponsor Does This—But the Good Ones Do

Let’s be real: most sponsors at eXp don’t organize local events or offer ongoing team connection. They bring you in and then it’s radio silence.

But a few sponsor teams treat this like a real commitment. They offer weekly masterminds, agent training, and occasional in-person meetups to make sure their agents are supported beyond the onboarding checklist.

So if you’re at one of those special teams? These sponsor meetups are your people-powered bonus. And if you’re not? It might be time to ask yourself if your “team” is just a name on paper.

Local Agent Meetups: Because Zoom Friends Are Even Better in Real Life

At eXp Realty, agents are everywhere. But that doesn’t mean they’re working in silos. Thanks to the company’s “we’re-in-this-together” culture, many eXp agents take it upon themselves to create local connections, with or without a formal event invite.

These real estate agent networking events might be as simple as coffee with colleagues or as organized as a standing monthly meetup. Some groups even host weekly Zoom calls, so by the time you meet face-to-face, you already know who loves scripts and who’s always multitasking with their mic off.

Why Do Agents Bother?

Simple: eXp Realty’s culture is built for collaboration, not competition. That tagline about being “the most agent-centric brokerage on the planet”? It’s not just marketing fluff. When your brokerage actively encourages sharing, growth, and cross-market teamwork, local meetups happen organically.

Agents gather to:

  • Swap strategies, templates, and war stories
  • Roleplay scripts or talk through tricky transactions
  • Celebrate wins (and survive the occasional appraisal fail)
  • Get that sense of team camaraderie minus the office drama

Sometimes these local events pop up around eXpcon or a regional rally, giving agents a chance to debrief, decompress, and dream big together. Other times, it’s just a Thursday coffee catch-up where someone casually drops a million-dollar idea.

No Stage, No Sponsors, No Pressure

What makes these local meetups special is that they’re grassroots. There’s no PowerPoint, and no guest speaker has flown in from corporate. It’s agents supporting agents. And in a virtual real estate brokerage, that kind of IRL connection can make a huge difference.

Whether you’re looking for tactical advice, referral partners, or just some humans who understand the chaos of back-to-back showings, local agent meetups give you a place to plug in.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Events

Are eXp Realty events required for agents?

No. Attendance at eXp Realty events is optional. Agents choose which events to attend based on their goals, schedule, and learning preferences. Events are designed to add value through collaboration and education, not to impose participation requirements.

How do eXp events compare to traditional brokerage conferences?

eXp events tend to emphasize peer collaboration and real-world application rather than hierarchical presentations. Because agents already collaborate virtually year-round, in-person events often feel more relational and immediately productive than traditional office-based conferences.

Who benefits most from attending eXp regional rallies?

Agents who want localized insight and nearby referral relationships benefit most from regional rallies. These events are particularly useful for agents focused on market-specific strategy, pricing trends, and building professional connections within driving distance.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

eXp Realty events are designed to support collaboration, learning, and agent connection, but they do not operate in isolation or replace the broader brokerage experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core platform, including compliance, compensation, technology, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with and how much organized collaboration exists beyond brokerage-level resources.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

What types of events does eXp Realty offer?

eXp Realty offers national conferences like EXPCON, regional rallies, sponsor-led meetups, and informal local agent gatherings. Together, these events support education, collaboration, and relationship building across production levels and markets without requiring physical office attendance.

Is EXPCON only for eXp Realty agents?

No. While EXPCON is designed primarily for eXp agents, it is open to real estate professionals, brokers, and vendors interested in learning about eXp’s model, tools, and collaborative culture before making a brokerage decision.

Do all sponsor teams host events?

No. Most sponsor teams at eXp Realty do not host events or structured meetups. Sponsor-led collaboration varies significantly between groups. Some sponsors organize regular virtual or in-person gatherings, while others provide little ongoing engagement, which is why sponsor ecosystem evaluation matters for agents who value structured community.

Is there an app for eXp Realty events?

Yes. The eXp Realty Events App helps attendees manage event participation by building personalized agendas, reviewing session details, accessing speaker information, and connecting with other agents. The app is commonly used during EXPCON and larger regional events to improve navigation, communication, and planning.

Related eXp Realty Community Guides

  • Collaborate and Grow Faster at eXp Realty: Why Teamwork Wins Here
  • Why Realtors Need Community (and How to Find the Right One)

title: Compass, Zillow, eXp Realty Clash with Off Market Listings
excerpt: Key Points Zillow has banned all exclusive delayed listing forever Off-market listings often sell for less Private listings can limit fair housing access Brokerages benefit…
content:
Key Points

  • Zillow has banned all exclusive delayed listing forever
  • Off-market listings often sell for less
  • Private listings can limit fair housing access
  • Brokerages benefit with exclusives with double commissions
  • Lead hoarding and agent recruiting drive brokerage goals
  • Public MLS listings provide faster sales and higher exposure
  • Industry rules are rapidly shifting toward transparency

So you’ve heard the news…there’s something going on with Compass, Zillow, eXp, and exclusive listings (aka off-market listings), also known as pocket listings, private exclusives, silent listings, and private listings?  

So why do some brokerages keep dangling exclusive listings like golden carrots? And why are companies like eXp Realty and Zillow tightening the screws on these off-market listings?

Buckle up—we’ve got the facts about off-market listings, a breakdown of what’s happening in the real estate industry, and what actually helps you serve your clients. Here’s your handy-dandy index:

What’s the Issue?

The Truth about Exclusive Delayed Listings

Why Some Brokerages Are Obsessed with Off-Market Listings

The New Listing Rules

More Brokerages Are Jumping on Board
Answering the Questions You Know Are Coming

Why the Off-Market Listing Battle Actually Matters
Frequently Asked Questions

What’s the Issue?

The issue is all about the rise of private delayed listings. Basically, some companies like Compass want them, love them, and heavily promote their usage to their clients.  However, Zillow, eXp Realty, and other real estate industry companies are taking a stand against these listings. Before we dig into why that is, let’s get clear about the primary types of listings.

Exclusive Private Listings

These live deep in the “If You Know, You Know” category. These off-market listings are only visible to the listing brokerage. No MLS. No yard sign. No Zillow. No other brokerages.  These listings are needed by some sellers for their privacy or safety.

Coming Soon Listings

These are like teaser trailers. Technically, Coming Soon homes are on the MLS, but they are not yet live for showings. Maybe the staging isn’t done, the dog’s still shedding all over the guest room, or hammers are still banging on the upgrades.  Coming soon listings are great for agents and their clients because they create a “heads up” to all brokerages and all agents so they know what’s coming soon to the market, giving everyone more time to prepare for their desired action.

But whether these “Coming Soon” listings show up immediately on Zillow depends on the local MLSs.  For example, in Marin County, CA, “Coming Soon” homes are not released to Zillow until the listing goes “active,” – which could be up to 30 days.

Active MLS Listings

Which brings us to Active Listings. They’re what most of us are here to do: get listings maximum exposure, get the best terms, and actually close deals. They’re the opposite of off-market listings—they’re visible to everyone, even  Zillow’s 3 a.m. scroll crowd.

Exclusive “Delayed Listings”

And herein lies the center of the new real estate industry struggle.  These exclusive delayed listings have big “test balloon” energy.  They’re basically a “soft” open where the listing gets shown to the brokerage’s private network of agents and clients before going public. Brokerages like Compass push this strategy hard. Called private exclusives, they pitch it like it helps sellers test pricing or build buzz without the ding of MLS days on market or price drops.

The Truth about Exclusive Delayed Listings

So, are exclusive delayed listings good for consumers?  For that answer, we can tap into a wealth of studies regarding exclusive listings. Let’s unpack the realities.?

Off-Market Homes Often Sell for Less

Research indicates that “office exclusives offer no price advantages over immediately promoting a home through the MLS”.  According to new Zillow research, private home sales don’t necessarily equate to higher profits for sellers. In fact, homes sold off the MLS fetched nearly $5,000 less on average than those listed publicly. In California, that median loss jumped to over $30,000. Ouch.?

Longer Time on Market

Patience might be a virtue, but in real estate, time is money. Standard listings take a median of 20 days to sell, while exclusive listings linger for about 37 days. That’s nearly double the time, potentially leading to increased holding costs and seller anxiety.?

Limited Exposure Hurts Buyers

With private sale homes, many potential buyers remain unaware of available properties. In some areas, more than 20% of listings never hit the public market. limiting options for buyers and potentially driving up competition for the remaining active listings market inventory.?

Fair Housing Concerns

Transparency isn’t just a buzzword; it’s a cornerstone of fair housing. Private listings can inadvertently sideline certain buyer groups, leading to a less inclusive market. Windermere Co-President OB Jacobi says, “I think the industry has always faced challenges with bad actors, and transparency creates accountability.

Potential Conflicts of Interest

When a single brokerage or agent controls both sides of a private home sale, proper representation can blur. The temptation to prioritize personal gain over client interest becomes a real concern, potentially compromising the fiduciary duty owed to clients.?

Why Some Brokerages Are Obsessed with Off-Market Listings

So if exclusive listings aren’t great for clients or consumers in general, why are some brokerages pushing exclusive delayed listings like it’s the smartest thing ever? The real reasons? Money. Control. And did we mention money?

Here’s how the math works out in the exclusive delayed listings brokerage’s favor:

Double-Dipping Commissions

When a listing stays off the MLS and a home sells, that brokerage gets the commission from the seller and from the buyer. That’s double the commission, half the objections, and no outside brokerage cutting into the profits. Great for the brokerage.

Recruiting Hook

Brokerages can use these private listings as a way to entice agents to join them.  They say “Hey, we’ve got off market listings you won’t find anywhere else.”  That talk gives agents the illusion of exclusivity—even when it’s just a private home sale pulled from a shared internal folder.

Lead Hoarding

Brokerages can also get plenty of new buyer leads from these listings.  That is, if a listing doesn’t hit the MLS or Zillow, that brokerage controls every single buyer lead. They collect emails, phone numbers, and future business off the backs of their private listings.

In the end, while off-market listings might offer a cloak of exclusivity, they’re all about increasing brokerage profits.

Brokerage Profit Needs

And, don’t get us wrong…a lot of brokerages seriously need these extra profits. For example, take Compass, which has rebranded these exclusive delayed listings into a full-blown strategy, pitching them as a “sophisticated” way to test the market. Spoiler: it may be less strategy and more of a survival tactic.

That’s because Compass, a publicly traded brokerage, has never had a profitable quarter. Not one.

On the flip side? eXp Realty is the ONLY profitable brokerage in the past 5 years among all publicly-traded brokerages.

Which might leave you thinking that Compass isn’t alone in being unprofitable.  That’s true, except Compass is dead last among all of them, and it’s not pretty. Compass’s earnings per share losses are more than twice as much as the number 2 loser, The Real Brokerage.  If you want to see all the earnings details, check out our blog on Brokerage Profitability. 

Bottom line: Compass needs a win, and it seems they have hung their hat here, on the pretend value of delayed exclusive listings. 

And guess what?  It may be working, well, sort of.  That is, reports say 55% of Compass’s February listings went the “private exclusive” route. But here’s the punchline: nearly 90% of those listings ended up on the MLS anyway. So much for exclusivity. And, the 10% that sold?  Extra money for Compass, potentially less money for their clients.

The New Listing Rules

Hmmm, off-market listings are on the rise, and now the big real estate industry actors are taking a stand long before the inevitable string of seller lawsuits.

Enter the Mammoth – Zillow

Off-market listings don’t just hurt sellers—they hurt Zillow, too. Platforms like Zillow make money by aggregating listings, putting them in front of buyers, and cashing in when someone clicks “Request a Tour.” That lead goes straight to a real estate agent who pays Zillow for the privilege. No listing? No lead. No profit.

So Zillow drew a big, bold line in the sand. Starting May 1, 2025, Zillow’s making it official. If a listing is marketed to anyone—even privately—it must be on the MLS and syndicated to Zillow within 24 hours. Or it’s banned. Forever. No Zillow.  Zillow’s Errol Samuelson said it best that a listing marketed to any buyer must be available to all buyers.

Think that won’t impact your client? Think again. Check out the Top 10 Most Visited Real Estate Websites—Zillow leaves everyone else in the dust. This stings because 96% of buyers use online tools in their search process. So, yes, it matters. A lot.

From RubyHome:

If your client’s home is invisible on Zillow, you’re going to need a very compelling reason. And “We wanted to test the waters” won’t cut it.

eXp Sides with Zillow & Raises the Bar

Just days after Zillow announced its new policy, eXp Realty is siding with Zillow.  And, eXp Realty didn’t just agree—they stepped up. While other brokerages stayed quiet, eXp took action to protect sellers by ensuring they fully understand the risks of going off-market.

For years, many exclusive listings slipped through without confirming whether the seller actually understood the downsides. eXp changed that. With an eXp exclusive advisory, every seller considering a private listing with an eXp agent must acknowledge those risks, and in a show of leadership, eXp made their exclusive listing seller advisory publicly available to all brokerages, large or small.

But they didn’t stop there. eXp has officially banned “delayed exclusive listings” across the board. If you’re an eXp agent, you play by the new rules—no exceptions.

For those rare cases where confidentiality is critical, sellers still have a path. It’s called eXp Access, eXp’s private listing portal—designed for privacy, but built with transparency in mind. eXp says that transparency isn’t just about compliance, it’s about trust.

More Brokerages Are Jumping on Board

The latest on Zillow’s new listings rules as the 2nd brokerage commits. NextHome joins eXp as an official partner in the move to bar listings that are publicly marketed but off-MLS. Redfin takes its own stand against CCP delayed listings. Redfin is not posting listings that have been publicly marketed before being shared on the MLS and IDX feeds. Also on board are California Regional MLS, Lamacchia Realty, Brown Harris Stevens and RE/MAX. 

Answering the Questions You Know Are Coming

Now that we’ve laid it all out, let’s get ahead of the confusion, because you will get questions. Here’s what you need to know so you’re not caught flat-footed.

“Won’t Zillow Ban Coming Soon Listings That Are Delayed?”

Nope. Coming Soon listings aren’t the same as private exclusives. They’re fully MLS-sanctioned and visible to all agents and clients across brokerages. Think of them as a heads-up to the market—“Hey market, this home’s almost ready—hang tight.”  . A Zillow rep said this complies with Zillow’s standards as long as a Coming Soon listing is entered in the MLS and is displayable on all sites receiving a feed. When the MLS syndicates these listings, Zillow will show them.

“What Happens If a Listing Gets Banned from Zillow?”

If a listing gets banned under Zillow’s new rule, the property isn’t blacklisted forever, but the original brokerage is. According to Zillow’s Errol Samuelson, if the listing is “relisted with a different brokerage and entered into the MLS within 24 hours of marketing, Zillow will display it.
Translation: if your brokerage messes up, the seller can fire you, relist with someone else, and still make it onto Zillow. But at that point, you’ve lost the listing, the client’s trust, and possibly your reputation.

“Will There Still Be Off-Market Private Listings?”

Yes—because sometimes privacy is the priority. Whether it’s a celebrity, a high-net-worth individual, or just someone who doesn’t want a sign in the yard or neighbors snooping, some sellers have no intention of going public. And, at eXp, sellers are fully informed of the tradeoffs. These homes aren’t meant for public marketing, and as long as the seller sticks to that plan, Zillow’s rule doesn’t apply.

Why the Off-Market Listing Battle Actually Matters

Off-market listings aren’t just a quirky tactic—they’ve become a flashpoint in real estate. Here’s the deal: your clients deserve clarity, not cloak-and-dagger sales strategies that quietly cost them tens of thousands. At eXp Realty, agents aren’t just trained to close deals—they’re empowered to do it the right way, with tech, support, and policies that actually protect the client.

If you’re ready to align yourself with the brokerage that prioritizes results over gimmicks, and you want the added support of a powerhouse team like Smart Agent Alliance, then it’s time to level up.

Smart Agent Alliance runs meetings so you gain passive income and gives agents access to:

  • A branded to you, hosted real estate agent attraction website
  • Social Agent Academy Pro ($10,500 value) for social media marketing
  • Weekly coaching sessions where you’ll be part of our agent family
  • Customizable lead funnels, email campaigns, and marketing templates
  • And more…

All free for agents who join eXp Realty and name Smart Agent Alliance as their sponsor. Learn more about how eXp Realty and Smart Agent Alliance can help you scale your career. Not sure if eXp is the right fit for you? Take this quick quiz to find out if eXp is a good match, especially if support and systems matter to you.

Not sure how passive income grows?  You can play with the numbers using our exp realty revenue share calculator to see how much you could earn. Not sure how to become a real estate agent? We’ve got loads of helpful info on that too.

Frequently Asked Questions

What are off-market listings?

Off-market listings mean the property isn’t listed on the MLS and isn’t publicly advertised. It’s only shown to a select group, typically within one brokerage’s network.

Do off-market listings sell for more money?

No. According to Zillow data, off-market homes often sell for less, over $30,000 less in California alone.

Why do brokerages like Compass use delayed exclusive listings?

Delayed exclusives let brokerages control leads, double-dip commissions, and lure new agents with the promise of private inventory—even if it’s not in the seller’s best interest.

What is eXp Realty’s policy on off-market listings?

eXp Realty bans delayed exclusive listings entirely and requires seller acknowledgment of risks for any true private listing. Transparency is non-negotiable.

Is Zillow banning Coming Soon listings?

Nope. Coming Soon listings are MLS-approved and visible to all agents. They’re not considered private exclusives and are allowed under Zillow’s rules.

title: How eXp Solutions Helps Agents Work Smarter, Not Harder
excerpt: Learn why eXp Solutions gives eXp agents a competitive edge—real estate vendors, powerful tech, and perks other brokerages just can’t match.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Realty solutions are not perks or mandatory tools.
They are optional partnerships designed to remove friction, lower overhead, and solve real business problems agents face, without dictating how an agent must run their business. eXp uses its scale to negotiate access to solutions agents can opt into when and if they need them.

TL:DR About eXp Realty Solutions:

  • eXp Realty solutions are optional, not required
  • They exist to reduce overhead, not create dependency
  • Agents can still work virtually, in physical offices, or both
  • Healthcare options help agents save meaningful money on a major blind spot
  • Lending, renovation, transaction, and vendor partners simplify complex deals
  • Solutions evolve over time as eXp identifies new agent pain points

Let’s be honest, digging through random real estate vendors on Google feels like DIY open-heart surgery. You’re either stuck with overpriced tech that doesn’t talk to your CRM, or vendors who ghost you after one email. Sound familiar? That’s exactly why eXp Solutions exists.

Instead of making agents fend for themselves, eXp Realty built a curated, plug-and-play system of top-tier tools, services, and real estate partners. From transaction coordination to agent healthcare, marketing tools, and automation platforms, eXp Solutions gives agents real value without the endless guesswork. And because eXp is one of the top real estate brokerage firms with over 87,000 agents, the value received is no joke.

This page is the hub for our eXp Realty Solutions series. Below is a big-picture overview of how solutions work at eXp, why they are structured differently than vendor programs at traditional brokerages, and where you can explore deeper guides on the solutions that matter most to you.

Here’s your index:

Table of Contents

How eXp Solutions Are Structured
eXp Solutions for eXp Realty Agents
Physical Offices Still Exist at eXp Realty
eXp Healthcare, Solving a Major Agent Blind Spot
Success Lending, Helping Transactions Move Faster
Curbio, Solving the Pre-Listing Renovation Problem
Additional eXp Realty Solutions
Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Realty Solutions
Smart Agent Alliance Disclosure
Frequently Asked Questions

Are eXp Realty solutions required for agents to use?
Do eXp agents have access to physical offices?
Is eXp Realty healthcare mandatory?
Can eXp agents use their own lenders, vendors, or service providers?
What types of problems are eXp Solutions designed to address?
Do eXp Realty solutions change over time?

How eXp Solutions Are Structured

eXp Realty solutions are built around a simple principle:

Optional support beats forced systems.

Instead of mandating tools, vendors, or office usage, eXp negotiates partnerships that agents can choose to use based on their business model, production level, and personal priorities.

At a high level, eXp solutions focus on:

  • Reducing fixed overhead
  • Solving real operational problems
  • Preserving agent independence
  • Leveraging company scale for better pricing and access

Each solution below addresses a specific friction point agents regularly face.

eXp Solutions for eXp Realty Agents

At its core, eXp Solutions is a curated ecosystem of vetted partners and services that agents can plug into as needed. These include healthcare, physical office access, transaction coordination, lending, renovations, signage, utilities, education, and closing services.

The key distinction is that none of these are required. Agents are free to use outside vendors, personal systems, or nothing at all.

eXp simply makes better options available.

Physical Offices Still Exist at eXp Realty

One objection some agents raise when evaluating a cloud brokerage is simple: “But I still want an office.”

eXp Realty addresses that directly.

While eXp does not rely on brick-and-mortar offices as a control mechanism, agents still have access to physical office space through global workspace partnerships. This gives agents flexibility without long-term leases, desk fees, or geographic restrictions.

Agents can meet clients professionally, work outside the home when desired, or travel and still access office space.

To see exactly how physical office access works at eXp and why it removes a major cloud brokerage objection, explore eXp Realty Offices in our full deep-dive guide.

eXp Healthcare, Solving a Major Agent Blind Spot

eXp Agent Healthcare, powered by Clearwater Benefits, gives eXp Realty agents access to customizable, affordable health plans that actually make sense for independent contractors.

Most real estate agents have no healthcare through their brokerage. That gap costs agents real money and stress.

eXp recognized that healthcare is one of the biggest hidden friction points for independent contractors and used its size to negotiate access to healthcare options specifically for agents and their families.

For many agents, healthcare savings alone materially change their financial picture.

To understand how eXp Healthcare works and why it is uncommon across brokerages, explore eXp Healthcare in our full deep-dive guide.

Success Lending, Helping Transactions Move Faster

Lending issues delay closings, frustrate clients, and cost agents deals.

Success Lending exists as a preferred lending solution that eXp agents can offer clients who want streamlined communication, integrated workflows, and experienced loan support.

This is not a requirement and not a captive lender. Agents remain free to work with any lender they choose. Success Lending simply provides an option designed to reduce friction when agents want tighter coordination between lending and transaction timelines.

To see how Success Lending fits into the eXp Solutions ecosystem, explore Success Lending in our full deep-dive guide.

Curbio, Solving the Pre-Listing Renovation Problem

Many sellers know their home needs work before listing. Most don’t want the hassle, upfront cost, or project management.

Curbio addresses that problem directly.

Through Curbio, agents can offer sellers pay-at-close renovation services focused on high-impact updates that help homes sell faster and for more money, without agents managing contractors or timelines.

This solution is ideal for agents who want to list homes in less-than-perfect condition without becoming renovation managers.

To see how pre-listing renovations work inside eXp Solutions, explore Curbio in our full deep-dive guide.

Additional eXp Realty Solutions

In addition to the solutions covered above, eXp Realty also offers access to:

  • Transaction coordination services
  • Branded and discounted signage
  • Home warranty partners
  • Utility and closing services
  • Continuing education providers
  • And many more

Not every solution has a standalone guide yet, and that’s intentional. eXp continually adds, adjusts, and replaces solutions as agent needs evolve.

The solutions ecosystem is not static. It grows as new friction points are identified.

Where Sponsorship Fits Into eXp Realty Solutions

eXp Realty provides the solutions. Sponsors do not control them.

Sponsors can help agents navigate which solutions make sense, but they do not require usage, change pricing, or restrict access. Agents retain full autonomy.

Smart Agent Alliance Disclosure

Smart Agent Alliance operates as an organized sponsor support structure within eXp Realty. Participation is optional and occurs only when an agent independently aligns with a Smart Agent Alliance–affiliated sponsor. Agents retain full independence and control of their businesses.

Full details are available on the Smart Agent Alliance eXp Realty sponsor page.

Frequently Asked Questions

Are eXp Realty solutions required for agents to use?

eXp Realty solutions are optional partnerships. Agents are not required to use any specific vendor, lender, healthcare plan, or transaction service. The brokerage negotiates access to these options at scale, but agents retain full control over which tools or providers they choose to incorporate into their business.

Do eXp agents have access to physical offices?

Although eXp operates as a cloud-based brokerage, agents can access physical office space through global workspace partnerships. These spaces are available on a flexible basis without long-term leases or mandatory desk fees, allowing agents to meet clients in person when needed while maintaining a virtual business model.

Is eXp Realty healthcare mandatory?

eXp Healthcare is an optional benefit available to eligible agents. Participation depends on individual needs and preferences. Agents may enroll in healthcare options offered through eXp’s negotiated partnerships, or they may choose entirely separate coverage outside of the brokerage’s available programs.

Can eXp agents use their own lenders, vendors, or service providers?

eXp Realty does not require agents to work with preferred partners. Solutions such as Success Lending or Curbio are available as optional resources, but agents remain free to select outside lenders, contractors, transaction coordinators, or vendors that align with their specific business relationships and market conditions.

What types of problems are eXp Solutions designed to address?

eXp Solutions focus on common friction points in real estate, including healthcare access, pre-listing renovations, lending coordination, transaction support, office access, and vendor pricing. The purpose is to reduce overhead and simplify operations, not to standardize how agents must run their business.

Do eXp Realty solutions change over time?

eXp evaluates partnerships and agent needs on an ongoing basis. Solutions may be added, adjusted, or replaced as the brokerage grows and identifies new operational challenges. Because these programs are optional, changes do not disrupt an agent’s core brokerage relationship or required systems.

title: How the eXp Homes Platform Is Structured
excerpt: How eXp Realty gives agents an edge with national listings, IDX websites, luxury exposure, and exclusive off-market properties through Zenlist.
content:
Key Takeaway: eXp Homes for Sale is not a single website but a multi-platform listing ecosystem that gives agents national MLS exposure, free IDX websites, luxury branding, and access to off-market listings, all built into eXp Realty’s technology platform.

TL;DR About eXp Homes for Sale at eXp Realty

  • eXp operates multiple listing platforms, not just one brokerage website
  • National MLS listings provide broad consumer exposure
  • eXp Luxury offers a premium search experience for high-end buyers
  • Every agent receives a free IDX website through supported CRMs
  • eXp Exclusives provide access to off-market and pre-market properties
  • Zenlist powers private listings and client collaboration for agents

Most brokerage websites are either consumer portals that bury agent branding or bare-bones profile pages that do nothing to generate business. eXp Realty built something very different. Instead of forcing all listings into a single generic site, eXp created a multi-layer listing ecosystem designed to support agents, clients, and different market segments.

This article explains how eXp Homes for Sale fits into the broader eXp Realty Technology ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

What Are eXp Realty Websites?

eXp Realty National Listings
eXp Luxury Listings: A Premium Experience for High-End Buyers
Agent Local Listings via Free IDX Websites
eXp Exclusive Listings: Off-Market Access, On-Point Advantage
How eXp Realty Websites Benefit Agents

Attract More Clients
Streamline Collaboration
Boost Your Brand
More Benefits That Actually Matter
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Homes for Sale

Is eXp Homes for Sale just one website?
How does this differ from Zillow or Redfin?
Who benefits most from eXp’s listing ecosystem?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Technology Guides

What Are eXp Realty Websites?

The eXp Realty website ecosystem is designed to do one thing really well—make life easier for agents and more impressive for clients. Instead of lumping everything into one generic portal, eXp splits its listings across four distinct platforms, each built for a specific purpose. Three are consumer-facing (national, luxury, and local agent sites), and one is exclusively for eXp agents to access private, off-market inventory.

This strategic setup gives agents multiple ways to showcase properties, attract clients, and build their brand, without paying extra for third-party tools. Let’s break down what each one offers:

eXp Realty National Listings

This is the main eXp Realty website, featuring a comprehensive MLS-powered real estate listings search for buyers across the U.S. The national eXp Realty site functions as a centralized MLS-powered search platform that displays listings while preserving agent branding and lead routing.

Every active MLS listing is pulled into one sleek interface, giving consumers a hassle-free way to find homes and giving agents a broader stage to promote their listings.

For agents, it’s a high-traffic national site that helps get listings maximum exposure while keeping your name front and center. The site pairs seamlessly with individual eXp agent sites, giving you tools to drive leads from your personal pages straight to your listings.

eXp Luxury Listings: A Premium Experience for High-End Buyers

The eXp Luxury website caters exclusively to upscale properties, offering a polished, boutique-style experience that high-net-worth buyers expect. Listings are presented with elevated branding, curated design, and a tailored search interface that makes premium homes feel, well, premium.

For agents, having your listings featured here means tapping into a market where presentation matters. It not only elevates your brand but positions you as a luxury expert. And if you’re part of eXp’s Luxury program, you’ll unlock specialized marketing materials, networking groups, and invite-only masterminds. Learn more about eXp Luxury for agents here.

Agent Local Listings via Free IDX Websites

Every eXp agent gets their own IDX website for realtors at no extra cost. These free IDX websites are fully customizable, packed with templates, widgets, and branding tools that let you stand out in your market.

Unlike most brokerages where agents get stuck with a single bio page, eXp gives you a full-fledged website where clients can search listings, sign up for alerts, and contact you directly. It’s a game-changing way to control your local online presence and keep leads in your orbit.

eXp Exclusive Listings: Off-Market Access, On-Point Advantage

eXp Exclusives, powered by Zenlist, gives agents access to a private database of off-market real estate listings—the kind of homes you won’t find on Zillow or even in the local MLS. These listings live inside a mobile-first app that’s free for every eXp agent, with built-in tools for collaborating with clients and managing deals on the go.

This eXp-only portal is where you’ll find pre-market opportunities, investor-friendly flips, and homes that sellers don’t want on the MLS – all homes that are not advertised publicly. The platform is commonly used by agents working with buyers seeking off-market or pre-market inventory not publicly advertised.

Zenlist access comes with the eXp Starter Plan, which includes collaboration with up to three client groups, MLS data, and the entire eXp Office Exclusive network. Upgrades are available if you want to go bigger, but even the free version is stacked.

How eXp Realty Websites Benefit Agents

With four powerful platforms under one roof, eXp Realty websites do more than just showcase listings—they empower agents to run smarter, grow faster, and build a brand that actually sticks. These aren’t your typical real estate sites that make agents fight for attention. Each one is purpose-built to support the agent experience from lead gen to closing (and all the chaos in between).

Whether you’re working with luxury buyers, savvy investors, or first-timers looking for homes on the MLS, eXp gives you a polished, tech-forward ecosystem that makes you look good and work even better. Here’s how agents benefit:

Attract More Clients

eXp websites open doors, literally and figuratively, by helping you connect with buyers and sellers through dynamic, customizable platforms. Instead of competing with third-party listing sites, you can send clients directly to your own IDX-powered website or use national and luxury portals to highlight your listings where the right eyes will find them.

You also get access to exclusive real estate listings that other agents simply can’t offer. From off-market opportunities on eXp Exclusives to pre-market homes inside Zenlist, you’ll be able to give your clients that “first look” advantage that builds loyalty (and wins deals).

With features like property search alerts, branded home pages, lead capture tools, and client collaboration portals, these sites don’t just sit there; they work for you.

Streamline Collaboration

Time is money, and wasting it with disconnected tools is so 2008. eXp’s platform is fully integrated with agent tools that keep your transactions, your clients, and your team running smoothly.

Agents can communicate with clients directly through their IDX site or Zenlist, push out curated property lists, and collaborate in real-time, even while on a showing. And when things get complex, you’re backed by a 24/7 support system and a cloud-based office where you can meet with staff, brokers, or other agents face-to-face (without ever putting on real pants).

Client-facing communication feels modern, responsive, and personal, which is exactly what today’s buyers and sellers expect.

Boost Your Brand

In a sea of templated agent bios and cookie-cutter websites, eXp agents stand out. Whether you’re showcasing homes on the national site, highlighting high-end listings on eXp Luxury, or customizing your personal IDX website for realtors, everything you present is professional, polished, and unmistakably yours.

Your name stays front and center. Your leads stay yours. And your brand builds every time someone interacts with your site, your listings, or your marketing materials. Combine that with global exposure, relocation partnerships, and a network of thousands of like-minded professionals, and you’ve got a platform built for growth.

More Benefits That Actually Matter

  • Free IDX websites mean you don’t have to pay third-party vendors for the basics.
  • Integrated lead capture keeps your contacts flowing into your free CRM.
  • Exclusive listing access helps agents stand out in a tight-inventory market.
  • International exposure gives your listings visibility far beyond your zip code.
  • Built-in marketing tools help you promote with zero design skills required.
  • No tech fees for core platforms (unlike many brokerages that nickel and dime).

At eXp, the tech actually works and it works for you. No bloated platforms, no outdated portals, and definitely no waiting for your broker to “fix it for you.” You’re in control, and your clients feel the difference.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Homes for Sale

Is eXp Homes for Sale just one website?

No. eXp Homes for Sale refers to a group of listing platforms that include the national MLS site, eXp Luxury, agent IDX websites, and private eXp Exclusive listings. Each platform serves a different purpose and audience within the overall technology ecosystem.

How does this differ from Zillow or Redfin?

Zillow and Redfin are third-party portals that monetize agent traffic. eXp Realty websites are designed to support agents directly, preserve branding, and integrate with internal tools like IDX websites and Zenlist without reselling leads.

Who benefits most from eXp’s listing ecosystem?

Agents working with buyers, sellers, luxury clients, or investors benefit most. The system supports multiple business models, including high-volume producers, niche specialists, and agents operating in low-inventory markets.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

eXp Realty technology is designed to address agent use cases like listings, lead capture, and collaboration, but it does not operate in isolation or replace the broader brokerage experience.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Do all eXp Realty agents get a free IDX website?

Yes. Agents who select a CRM that supports websites, such as BoldTrail, receive a free IDX website as part of eXp Realty’s technology platform. Agents who choose CRMs without website functionality do not receive an IDX site.

Are eXp Exclusive listings available to the public?

No. eXp Exclusive listings are private, off-market, or pre-market properties shared only among eXp Realty agents. These listings are not visible on public portals or MLS feeds.

Is Zenlist included for eXp Realty agents?

Yes. All eXp Realty agents receive a Zenlist Starter plan at no cost. This includes access to MLS listings, eXp Exclusives, and limited client collaboration features, with optional upgrades available.

Do eXp listings replace personal agent marketing?

No. eXp Realty websites complement personal marketing efforts. Agents still control branding, outreach, and client relationships, while the platforms provide infrastructure and exposure.

Related eXp Realty Technology Guides

  • BoldTrail CRM: The Game-Changer eXp Realty Agents Get for Free!
  • Inside eXp World: The Virtual Office Explained
  • SkySlope: eXp Simplifies Transaction Management for Agents

title: How eXp Realty Agent Resources Are Structured
excerpt: eXp Realty agent resources help you work smarter, faster, and grow stronger. Learn how this agent-first brokerage keeps leading the industry.
content:
Key Takeaway: Innovation at eXp Realty is not marketing language, it is an operating system. Because the brokerage is profitable and virtual by design, it continuously reinvests in agent resources, technology, and infrastructure that help agents work more efficiently without increasing fees or adding friction.

TL;DR About eXp Realty Innovation and Agent Resources

  • eXp Realty reinvests brokerage profits directly into agent tools and systems
  • Innovation is driven by a cloud-based model, not physical office overhead
  • New agent resources are released regularly, with major launches at EXPCON
  • Technology is designed to simplify workflows, not add platforms
  • Agent resources support productivity, marketing, analytics, and collaboration
  • Innovation functions as part of eXp’s broader agent support ecosystem

Most brokerages treat innovation as a one-time upgrade. At eXp Realty, innovation is ongoing infrastructure. Because the company operates virtually and remains consistently profitable, it can reinvest in agent resources that evolve with the market instead of reacting after agents feel the pain. 

This article explains how innovation and agent resources fit into the broader eXp Realty support ecosystem available to eXp agents. Here’s your handy dandy index:

Table of Contents

Why eXp Realty Stays Ahead of the Pack
Constantly Evolving: eXp’s New Resources and Innovations
How Does eXp Realty Keep Raising the Bar?
The eXp Business Model in a Nutshell
What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Innovation

Are eXp Realty agent resources included, or do agents pay extra for them?
How often does eXp Realty release new tools or updates?
How does eXp Realty innovation compare to traditional brokerages?
Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty
Frequently Asked Questions

Related eXp Realty Support

Why eXp Realty Stays Ahead of the Pack

Through its innovative, agent-first model, eXp Realty has reshaped what a real estate brokerage can be and has become the brokerage that serves more families than any other. This isn’t just some rebranded franchise with a new logo—it’s a full-blown evolution of the industry. By putting agents at the center of every decision, eXp has flipped the traditional brokerage pyramid upside down. The result? A business model that runs on agent empowerment, profitability, and relentless modernization.

This agent-centric design gives eXp agents access to a steady stream of real estate agent resources, tools, and support that keep up with the pace of the industry. Where most brokerages play catch-up, eXp is leading the charge. From automated marketing to productivity dashboards and virtual real estate workspaces, the company’s cloud-based infrastructure means agents can scale smarter and faster, without the baggage of outdated tech or expensive office overhead.

Let’s talk about the innovation real estate agents can feel. eXp Realty doesn’t just slap “tech-forward” on a flyer—it shows up with the goods. Whether it’s interactive listing tools, real-time CRM integrations, or AI-powered lead systems, every piece of technology for real estate is designed to help agents grow their business, not just survive market shifts. No more juggling platforms that don’t talk to each other. No more hours wasted on manual follow-up. Just smooth, integrated systems that make it easier to do your job and look good doing it.

And guess what? That kind of innovation directly boosts client service, too. When you’ve got tools like virtual walkthroughs, branded buyer/seller kits, and live communication links at your fingertips, your buyers and sellers feel it. They trust it. That confidence leads to faster deals, better referrals, and more long-term wins.

Constantly Evolving: eXp’s New Resources and Innovations

Most brokerages stick with the same old tools year after year. eXp Realty? It rolls out new resources consistently, keeping agents ahead of the curve. Sure, there are updates throughout the year, but it’s at EXPCON—eXp’s largest annual in-person event—where you can expect a game-changing lineup of announcements. These aren’t just surface-level tweaks. We’re talking real estate agent resources that directly enhance productivity, boost marketing efforts, and drive profitability, all tailored to help eXp agents work smarter and grow faster.

In 2024, eXp Realty came out swinging. At EXPCON Miami, they revealed the acquisition of luxury marketing platform LUXVT, added full agent access to Canva Pro (Enterprise level, loaded with pre-built eXp templates), rolled out a sleek new public website, and announced a powerful partnership with Sisu—a business intelligence platform that helps agents track performance and streamline operations.

2023 was just as stacked. That year, eXp launched eXp Exclusives, giving agents and their clients first dibs on pre-market and off-market listings. The Listing Presentation Kit and Active Listing Kit debuted as customizable, high-impact marketing tools. eXp World moved from a clunky download to a browser-based experience, and agents gained access to My Link My Lead, a tool that turns content into clickable lead funnels.

Other recent innovations include the launch of eXp Luxury, SUCCESS® Coaching, and SUCCESS® Lending, plus the expansion of the Revenos referral network and the debut of SUCCESS Health. These aren’t just shiny extras—they’re built-in tools tied directly to eXp Realty agent success, showing exactly why the eXp business model is in a league of its own.

How Does eXp Realty Keep Raising the Bar?

Let’s talk money—specifically, eXp profits, and how they’re put to work. Unlike many brokerages still patching holes in a sinking ship, eXp Realty is not just surviving—it’s profitable. Very profitable! And instead of hoarding those profits, eXp reinvests them directly into agent resources that move the needle. We’re talking upgraded technology for real estate, cutting-edge marketing tools, and advanced training platforms that help eXp agents work smarter, not harder.

That sustainable, reinvest-and-grow model isn’t just smart—it’s empowering. It creates long-term growth, better eXp agent support, and a system that evolves with the market instead of reacting to it ten steps too late. This is what agent-focused innovation looks like in practice, and it’s one of the biggest eXp Realty benefits there is.

Now, how can eXp afford to outpace every other brokerage when it comes to real estate agent resources? Easy: it’s the only publicly traded real estate brokerage that’s been profitable for the past five years. Yep, the only one! That’s a big deal because when brokerages bleed money, guess who ends up covering the costs? You. Are those surprise “admin fees,” downgraded tools, or mysterious commission split changes? That’s not bad luck—it’s a business model in crisis.

Unprofitable brokerages cut corners, easy to see when you read anonymous agent reviews. Those brokerages stall on tech upgrades. They lay off support teams. They rebrand, restructure, or vanish altogether. And somewhere in the middle of a transaction, you’re the one left explaining it to a confused client. That’s not just annoying—it’s a hit to your credibility and your paycheck.

The most successful real estate companies don’t just weather tough markets—they prepare for them. They manage expenses, leverage smart systems, and protect their agents’ bottom line. So if you’ve ever Googled “is eXp Realty profitable?” or “How to value a real estate brokerage”, here’s your answer: the value of eXp lies in its sustainability because broke brokerages break agents. eXp is built to keep you winning.

The eXp Business Model in a Nutshell

The eXp Realty business model is simple: cut the overhead and boost the value. As a fully virtual real estate brokerage, eXp eliminates the cost of brick-and-mortar offices and reinvests in technology for real estate, training, and agent support. With tools like eXp World, BoldTrail, Sisu, and full Canva Pro access, agents get everything they need to grow, without paying extra for office furniture they’ll never use.

More than 85,000 agents worldwide are thriving in this cloud-based, agent-first model—because when you remove the fluff and focus on what helps agents succeed, everybody wins.

What Agents Also Ask About eXp Realty Innovation

Are eXp Realty agent resources included, or do agents pay extra for them?

Core agent resources are included as part of the brokerage platform. These tools are funded through the company’s operating model rather than sold individually. Agents may still choose optional third-party services, but the primary innovation stack is built into eXp Realty support.

How often does eXp Realty release new tools or updates?

Updates occur throughout the year, with larger announcements typically made at EXPCON. Smaller enhancements and refinements are released on an ongoing basis, allowing agent systems to improve continuously rather than through infrequent major overhauls.

How does eXp Realty innovation compare to traditional brokerages?

Traditional brokerages often rely on local offices to choose tools and fund upgrades. eXp Realty centralizes innovation, allowing it to deploy consistent resources across markets without relying on franchise-level decisions or physical infrastructure investments.

Why This Matters Before You Join eXp Realty

Support through eXp Realty agent resources is designed to help agents access tools and internal infrastructure, but it does not operate independently or replace the broader eXp Realty platform.

At eXp Realty, all agents receive the same core brokerage platform, including compliance, compensation, and access to company divisions. What differs is the sponsor ecosystem an agent aligns with.

The sponsor is selected during the application process, before most agents have used the brokerage’s systems, explored its tools, or seen how sponsorship works in real life. Knowing where sponsorship fits within eXp Realty’s overall structure helps agents view this decision in the right context.

Frequently Asked Questions

Is eXp Realty innovation the same in every market?

Yes. Core agent resources and technology platforms are deployed centrally, ensuring consistency across markets. Local compliance rules vary by location, but the underlying innovation stack remains the same for all agents regardless of geography.

Does innovation replace broker or support staff at eXp Realty?

No. Technology supports efficiency, but broker teams and employee support remain responsible for compliance, approvals, and escalation. Innovation reduces friction, but human oversight and support are still central to the brokerage model.

Are agents required to use every eXp Realty tool?

No. Agents choose which resources fit their business model. Innovation expands available options but does not mandate adoption. Agents can integrate tools selectively while still operating within the eXp platform.

Can innovation slow down if market conditions change?

Because eXp Realty funds innovation through profitability rather than debt or franchise fees, investment in agent resources is designed to remain stable even during market downturns.

Related eXp Realty Support

Innovation and agent resources work alongside other core support systems. If you are exploring how support functions across the brokerage, these related guides provide additional context:

  • How eXp Onboarding Works in 6 Steps – And How Not to Blow It
  • How eXp Helps Agents Before They Ever Join
  • Why eXp Employees Make This the Best Brokerage for Agent Support
